review:
Overwatch morreu em 2018 quando anunciaram Overwatch 2.

Esqueça que OW é um jogo e pense nele como um universo, como uma história. A blizzard agora só faz modos, skins, passes de batalha de forma preguiçosa, reutilizando assets apenas para vender por preços exorbitantes.

Todo o conteúdo gratuito providenciado, desde modos de jogo até skins são extremamente mal trabalhados, feitos apenas para a comunidade não reclamar e dizer que eles estão apenas querendo vender.

A melhor forma que vejo de encarar esse jogo é esperar a Blizzard lançar o modo histórias aos poucos (porque já até cancelaram o modo história como modo separado, oque era o MOTIVO de criarem OW2), encontrar um streamer que compre o modo e assistir, assim você acompanha a história. Fora isso nem vale a pena, porque você vai ter que pagar meu mano.

I may not have played as long as others, but I really loved Overwatch 1 and when they said they would be making a new game with an actual story and fun PVE missions with a variety of unique new skills for each character, I was so thrilled. Then they released OW2 with none of that and a predatory battlepass and store. Part of me wanted to overlook this and think maybe they need the extra money to help make the PVE more fun, despite it being several years since its announcement. Then they canned it. It's now an empty husk of what it once was. Just extended, boring event missions. To the people crying that folks are "review bombing", I suggested reading through a few of them. You'll realise that it comes from a place of passion and hurt. We loved this game. But Blizzard doesn't, and sees it as nothing more then a cash grab. 
Don't spend your money on this. Don't give them even a penny.
游戏是好游戏，曾经是。当年辛辛苦苦肝的金皮金武说没就没，你现在上架国际服装给谁看？傻逼暴雪操你妈，婢养的赶紧下架你这破jb游戏吧，不嫌丢人？

Depois de termos passado por vários problemas como adiamentos, decepções, escândalos, escolhas ruins, descaracterização dos personagens, eventos repetitivos, falta de conteúdo, problemas de servidor e péssimo sistema de obtenção de skins e uma ESPERA DE 3 ANOS PARA LANÇAREM O MESMO JOGO SOQUE PIOR, finalmente tivemos uma noticia boa, o lançamento do jogo na steam e 3 missões porcaria por 70 reais.

Ah muito obrigado Blizzard, você não precisa ser tão gentil.

I like my games finished

There are a small percentage of users which you probably know as Whales. 
They make up 5-10% of the player base, but generate 90% of revenue.
If there isnt a healthy pool of players, the whales leave and this game officially dies.

Blizzard isnt trying to improve the game for the casual gamer, they are putting in the bare minimum to encourage others to stay and keep playing with these whales (their intended customers). Hence the steam launch to try and gather more players to use as fodder. 

OW truly has so much potential as a game, but unfortunately the game is riddled with micro transactions and poor match making. I wish i was there in 2016 to happily pay full price for this game and earn all cosmetics and play events for "free".

Imagine paying $40 for some watered down PvE missions, there are AAA games on steam right now cheaper than that. OW reeks of corporate greed. 

Another game down the drain due to greed. While yes my review is negative, it is not impossible to salvage OW, but blizzard is incompetent in doing so
I don't care how hot the new robot skins are i am NOT buying their CANCELLED PVE they're trying to salvage for attention

Ah I'm so glad to see Overwatch is on steam now! Is what I would've said if they did this 6 years ago. The only reason I'm excited for this game to be on steam now is to write this negative review. This game is not worth the 34 gigs on your computer, and most importantly, not worth your precious time.


Blizzard has absolutely ruined Overwatch and it will never be the same. Going from a system where you pay for the game and can pay for loot boxes if you'd like extra cosmetics to a free game with extremely overpriced cosmetics, a paid battle pass, AND [u]locking new heroes behind a paywall[/u] is extremely scummy behavior and I don't understand how people enjoy the system? I'm sure new players that never touched OW1 [i]might [/i]enjoy this game but as an early OW1 player it's hard to like the game when it was 10x better before. I think if they didn't combine the 2 games it could've been better. Especially if they reverted 1 back to how it was in 2016 lol.

[h1]Game Changes:[/h1]
Almost everything they changed was horrible to the game. Specifically switching to a 5v5 system with a single (more powerful) tank. This might've been implemented this in 1, but, there's "Role Queue" meaning you have to queue and have specific ranks as damage, support, or tank. And whichever role you choose your stuck with for the whole game. So when your damage teammates decide to pick a hero that doesn't work for the map or is getting hard countered (and isn't switching) you basically can't do anything. You can't switch to damage to contribute if you were to queue as support or tank. It's a [u]team game[/u] for a reason. Absolutely awful system. The only two things I do like changed about the heroes is the new passives everyone gets, and actually reworking some characters that weren't fun. BUT reworking a couple heroes and making small changes that could've been an update to Overwatch 1 is extremely overwhelming. 3-4 years of no updates and this is what we get...? And maybe the only other "good" change you can say is it's free now, but the other monetization methods they included are horrible. There is a bunch of other small things they removed like end cards that shows match stats and a player level border on ur character that aren't super important but were really cool features to see in game.


[h1]Modes:[/h1]
The new gamemode push is absolutely awful. Games are way too long, runbacks from spawn take forever, losing means you need to do over 2x the work to win, and overall the maps aren't fun. Also I know the mode assault (the 2 capture point mode) was really toxic and hard to play as both attacker and defender, but I'm really disappointed to see they didn't even try reworking it and took out so many beautiful maps like Hanamura and Temple of Anubis. I can't say how the mode Flashpoint is because it literally just released with the release on steam, I won't be playing, but with how Blizzard has been releasing new content I don't have high hopes.


[h1]PVE:[/h1]
Honestly, I only played OW2 for like 20 hours max but told myself I'd be back when the PVE was finally out. Already scummy in itself for them to release an unfinished game without the ONLY reason they were making a new game, but whatever. It was gonna come out later right? Nope. Fully scrapped. Remember this was the MAIN REASON they were making a new game? All gone because I guess they think if they work on PVP they could milk more money from players. And the Overwatch 2 simps would say "Well they are still making PVE!" Yeah sure [i]technically[/i] but it's quickly thrown together with no skill tree or meaningful story. AND they are selling it to you for $15 per map. Just go buy Battlebit Remastered with that. Better game AND devs.


[h1]Surprisingly enough, things I like:[/h1]
I won't be playing on steam or at all but it is quite nice you don't need to install their launcher to play. Only requirement is to have an account with them, more companies need to do this (Looking at you ubisoft.) Also including achievements is something I didn't expect. I unfortunately had to launch the game to be able to write this review, but also nice that they give you all the achievements you unlocked before it came to steam. The only good thing I can say about this game is the new heroes. I only played when the game first came out with Kiriko, Junker Queen, and Sojourn and they were all pretty fun. The new ones look okay but locking them behind a paywall is disgusting. This game isn't worth it anymore. Sadly.
This game is being review bombed. It's not as bad as players make it out to be.
Jeff wouldn't be proud.

En cuanto al juego, pues obviamente está en Steam para no quedarse sin jugadores, arriesgándose a sacarlo de Battle.net a una plataforma donde la gente puede dar su opinión.
La excusa del "2" de Overwatch era que iba a tener un modo historia con sistema de talentos, mejoras, y progresión del lore, y no se podía hacer en el motor del juego original, pero fue cancelado hace dos meses durante un stream con los desarrolladores porque y cito textualmente "era difícil de hacer".
Esto se cancela tras 4 años de desarrollo en el que el Overwatch original no tuvo contenido. Ahora, nos dan las sobras de este sistema cancelado, bajo pasarela de pago, donde en cooperativo hay que derrotar oleadas de robots, muy similar al evento de Archivos que ya nos ofrecieron en Overwatch 1 hace muchos años. Así que no te dejes engañar, por mucho que el parche de Invasión lo vendan como de "historia", no tiene nada que ver con lo que prometieron.

Así que sí, los memes de [b]EL MISMO JUEGO 2[/b] son totalmente ciertos. Solo que ahora el juego es gratis con pase de batalla y tienda, a la cual te intentan llevar continuamente en casi todos los menús.

Mejor échate unos [b]Team Fortress 2[/b].

[h1]Overwatch 2 ist ein Nachfolger, den niemand gebraucht hat.[/h1]


Blizzard hat mit Overwatch 2 bewiesen, dass es noch schlimmeren Greed als EA gibt.

Du willst den neuen Held/in spielen? Gib uns 10€ oder grinde mind. 2 Wochen.
Du willst den neuen Skin haben? Gib uns 20€ und mit einem Spray den niemand nutzt 25€.
Du willst die PVE Missionen Spielen? Gib uns 15€ und du kannst 3 Missionen mit kaum neuen Inhalten spielen.
Du willst den Battlepass? Zahle in jeder Season 10€, da es keine Echtgeld-Währung im Battlepass als Belohnung gibt.

Bevor Overwatch 2 veröffentlicht wurde, waren die oben genannten Punkte kostenfrei und man wurde immer mit neuen Inhalten überfüllt.

Außerdem wurden wir von den Entwicklern an der Nase herumgeführt.
2019 wurde Overwatch 2 angekündigt mit einem riesigen PVE Universum.
Uns wurde versprochen dass man seine Helden LVLN und mit Skills upgraden kann. Somit haben die PVE Missionen Wiederspielbarkeit.
Uns wurde versprochen dass man zusammen mit Overwatch 1 Spieler zusammen spielen kann.
In Overwatch 2, Season 4 wurden wir von den Entwicklern auf die aufkommende PVE gehypt. In Overwatch Season 5 kam dann ein Statement und eine Entschuldigung von den Entwicklern, dass Overwatch 2 PVE gecancelt wird und es nur 3 "normale" PVE Missionen gibt. In einem späteren Interview zu der gecancelten PVE ist dann herausgekommen, dass diese Entscheidung schon vor Jahren entschieden wurde. Statt den Spielern dies zu sagen, hat Blizzard das bis kurz vor Veröffentlichung der PVE geheim gehalten um so viel Geld wie möglich den Spielern aus der Tasche zu ziehen.

Jetzt ist Overwatch 2 auf Steam um neue Spieler zu fangen und noch mehr Geld einzunehmen.
Smarter Move von Blizzard. Doch hier auf Steam, kann man seine Meinung über das Spiel schreiben was im Battle.net Launcher nicht geht.

Wenn man sich nicht von den ganzen Ingame-Käufen verführen lässt, ist Overwatch 2 eigentlich ein gutes Game.

Müsst Ihr wissen.
